Package au.edu.anu.rscs.aot.archetype

Class Archetypes

java.lang.Object
au.edu.anu.rscs.aot.archetype.Archetypes
All Implemented Interfaces:
ArchetypeArchetypeConstants
public class Archetypes extends Object implements ArchetypeArchetypeConstants

Checks that a set of specifications complies with the set of rules and constraints grouped in an archetype.

This code was initially developed by Shayne Flint as the core of Aspect-Oriented Thinking (AOT) and has been deeply refactored by J. Gignoux.

It checks that a graph (a TreeGraph, actually, i.e. a tree with cross-links) complies with an archetype graph (actually, a Tree) describing how graphs should look like. In other words, it is a tool for checking that specifications or configurations comply with requirements. The archetype describes the requirements. Notice that the first check that is provided here is to check that an archetype... is an archetype, i.e. complies with the requirements needed to call a graph an archetype.

Afer a call to any of the check(...) methods, errorList() may be called to retrieve all checking errors.

NB: an archetype is a Tree, but a configuration/specification graph is a TreeGraph.

NOTE: by default this class spits a lot of log messages. These are logged at the INFO level (="debugging"), so if you want to get rid of them just set the log level to WARNING.

Author:
Jacques Gignoux - 6 mars 2019, Shayne Flint - looong ago

    • check

      public void check​(fr.cnrs.iees.graph.NodeSet<?> graphToCheck, ArchetypeRootSpec archetype)
      checks that graphToCheck complies with archetype. Here, archetype is the root node of an archetype tree.
      Parameters:
      graphToCheck - the graph to check (usually a Tree or a TreeGraph)
      archetype - the archetype root node to check against
